column4: Installed Ubuntu 9.10 on a Dell Latitude D600, cannot get connected to the interent wirelessly. I tried sudo lshw -C network and it is disabled. Does anyone know how to enable it or something else I should try?
pastebin your lspci -nnk output
do that in the termerinal?
yes
you're not typing it right, a correct output would show you all the devices connected via PCI or related methods
I did it with sudo it now says PCI access options
that isn't right either
ok tried this sudo lshw -C network and it show that it is disabled
I don't need lshw, I need "lspci -nnk"
here: http://mike.passwall.com/nblug/kernel-talk/lspci.html
got it to work was typing output with it
what do you need now
need you to copy the contents of that output and paste it into pastebin, then send me the link

I have no way to copy anything over right now does this help? 02:00.0 Ethernet controller [0200]: Broadcom Corporation NetXtreme BCM5705M Gigabit Ethernet [14e4:165d](rev 01 Kernel driver in use:tg3 Kernel modules:tg3
wrong line, that's not a wireless chipset, google it and you'll see what I mean or paste the whole thing
no, not one bit
in fact that's worse than your previous guess
there's like 7 different wireless manufacturers out there
and I can't see how you can't copy the entire lspci -nnk output
you mean its on another computer?
do you not have a spare network cable that you can plug it into?
lspci -nn| grep 14e4:43
02:03.0 Network controller [0280]: Broadcom Corporation BCM4309 802.11a/b/g [14e4:4324] (rev 03)
read the part on "Installing b43/STA hybrib drivers"
